title: ğŸŒ SONIC & EgoScale: Open-Source Humanoid Motion & Dexterous Control Frameworks from NVIDIA Robotics

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text: What can half of GPT-1 do? We trained a 42M transformer called SONIC to control the body of a humanoid robot. It takes a remarkable amount of subconscious processing for us humans to squat, turn, craw

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text: We trained a humanoid with 22-DoF dexterous hands to assemble model cars, operate syringes, sort poker cards, fold/roll shirts, all learned primarily from 20,000+ hours of egocentric human video with

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text:
This is a huge team work at NVIDIA Robotics. Check out @ruijie_zheng12's deep dive: 

- Website: https://t.co/n3Zp8bh8Ht
- Paper: https://t.co/eXQqSl3GHg

https://t.co/ybup5DhSCM

key_facts: NVIDIA Robotics team open-sourced SONIC â€” a 42M-parameter transformer that enables zero-shot transfer of diverse whole-body motions (squat, sprint, dance, teleoperation) to real Unitree G1 robot with 100% success on 50 sequences

Introduced 'EgoScale' â€” a scalable pre-training paradigm using 20,000+ hours of egocentric human video to achieve dexterous manipulation (e.g., model car assembly, syringe operation, card sorting) with extreme data efficiency (4h robot play data yields 54% gains; single teleop demo suffices for novel tasks)

Leveraged NVIDIA Isaac Lab for 10,000Ã— accelerated physics simulation, enabling years of virtual experience in hours; achieved cross-hardware transfer from 22-DoF Sharpa hands to 7-DoF Unitree G1 tri-finger hands
analyst_angle: This represents a paradigm shift: open-sourcing production-grade, data-efficient, human-video-driven humanoid control stacks lowers the barrier to entry for embodied AI research and signals NVIDIAâ€™s strategic bet on human-centric scaling â€” not just more robots, but *us* as the ultimate training data source.
